intro: Fagara annobonensis, commonly known as the Annobon Island fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the island of Annobon in the Gulf of Guinea. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic to ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically white or pale green in color. The fruit is a small, smooth, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
